text.title: vegan recipes for dinner that everyone will love
text.p: I feel like you got to make everything
in this video but especially make

this this little situation too good

okay this is so

good
[Music]
M it's great
hello beautiful people welcome back to
my channel I'm so excited that you're
here this week I wanted to record a
week's worth of dinners and I'm really
excited to make them if you are new here
don't forget to hit that subscribe
button be sure to check out the rest of
my videos because I have so much
inspiration from breakfast lunch dinner
snacks what I eat in the day what I eat
in the week Vlogs as well and speaking
of Vlogs I did see some requests on my
last video because I did ask like you
know what should I what type of content
should I share more of and I saw some
requests for the Vlogs I did used to do
vlogs so I think I might pick that back
up because we've been doing so much in
Seattle I post some of it on my Tik Tok
so if you're not actually if you're not
following me on my other social media
channels be sure to do so I'm on
Instagram and Tik Tok on Tik Tok I tend
to post more food lifestyle and just
like on a regular basis whereas over on
Instagram I tend to just post food
honestly also this is something I've
been putting in the comment section of
my my videos in the past but if you are
here as a way to support me please don't
skip the ads at least the ones that are
short like don't skip those I know that
they have some that are very very long
but the ads are ways that YouTube
compensates the creators by watching
Those ads you are in turn supporting me
so I just want to say thank you in
advance I put this in the comment
section on the past few videos and there
are so many people who didn't realize
that that was a thing and people were
telling me like you know I'm watching
the ads thank you for letting me know so
I just wanted to mention that in the
video versus just putting it in the
comment section so yeah let's keep going
with the video if you've been here you
know I am good for making a taco a
taquito or a good old play- nachos I
just really love crunchy food so with
that being said we're making taquitos
for dinner I've made these at least
three times in the last two weeks
because I just enjoy them so much and
it's a great way to get your fiber in
your protein in they're just great I
filled these taquitos with red bell
peppers green bell peppers and some
diced onions baby bella mushrooms and
some plant-based grounds actually
speaking of plant-based grounds you know
what I haven't made in a while my
mushroom and walnut meat I need to make
that again soon and throw some pea
protein crumbles in there for some extra
protein yeah I'm going to do that but
okay back to this meal I cooked up the
peppers onions mushrooms and plant-based
grounds with the taco seasoning blend
that I put together using just some
spices that I have on hand I've been
making my own seasoning blends with the
spices and it's just made cooking so
much easier but I'll have to show you
how I put those together one of these
days when I was making these I
completely forgot that I had some black
beans in the pantry and I was supposed
to use them here I didn't realize it
until later in the week that they were
in the pantry but I ended up using them
in another recipe which you'll see in
this video but the taquitos were still
delicious so it was okay so I wrapped
that filling with a corn tortilla and I
used a toothpick to hold them together
sprayed them generously with olive oil
oil just to ensure that they got crispy
in the oven because that's what we need
I baked them in the oven on 400Â° until
they were crispy and I served them with
a dairyfree sour cream avocado salsa a
plant-based queso and I'll put the
brands that I use in the description
also in the description is going to be a
link to this free grocery list that I
put together which has all of my goto
and must have items for a plan-based
kitchen and I also share some of my
favorite Brands so that'll be in the
description as well
[Music]
well sorry if you can hear my dishwasher
but I just dug into the first one it is
amazing so
delicious hey guys I'm about to make
dinner but I was just about to make
myself a quick little appetizer so have
some sauerkraut that I'm about to snack
on like while I cook but today is
Tuesday and for dinner dinner I really
wanted to make a plant-based rasta pasta
I have this protein pasta that I'm
really excited to use I just got it in
the mail I ordered it off Amazon it's
only like two ingredients and I'm going
to use that as my source of protein and
carbs today here is the sauerkraut I
love sauerkraut so much it's good and
it's good for you I'm actually going to
started on dinner a bit early today
early being earlier than usual I don't
know what it is if it's the Sun going
down later our new place being more well
lit I have been eating dinner pretty
late and I want to stop that so I'm
looking forward to actually eating food
earlier today let's get started with
meal number two for this video so as
mentioned on this day we are making a
plant-based roster pasta and y'all this
was a 10 out of 10 I know I mentioned
that I used a protein pasta that I order
from Amazon I added that to my Amazon
stor friend so that link will also be in
the description honestly you can find
all my links there links my website my
recipes my cookware my social channels
all the things so just be sure to check
that out but if you plan to make the
recipes that I'm sharing in this video
just go ahead and stock up on bell
peppers because while I was editing this
I was thinking to myself girl you are
cooking with these peppers like you own
a pepper Garden because this rasta pasta
is loaded with peppers and other
goodness like red onions garlic green
onions and so after cooking the peppers
garlic and onions I added in a can of
unsweetened coconut milk I actually use
like coconut milk for just personal
preferences but I know that most rasta
pasta recipes encourage you to use full
fat unsweetened coconut milk but I
decided to stick with the light coconut
milk and then just add a bit of the
dairyfree cream cheese to help with the
consistency and it really got the job
done and just continue to stir that
until the dairyfree cream cheese is
combined well on this dish now since
this is a rasta pasta we are going to
add even more flavor to this I also
added in black pepper a mild sauce thyme
paprika and some garlic powder now most
rasta pasta recipes call for cheese but
two things one I didn't have any
plant-based cheese on hand and I really
didn't feel like using any of the
store-bought plant-based cheese so I
just used nutritional yeast instead and
it worked well and so after I combined
everything I wanted this to thicken up a
bit so I just reduced the heat to low
and allow this to simmer for a bit I
realized I completely forgot about the
green onions so I just threw those was
in there afterwards but it ended up
working out because this pasta was
everything and
[Music]
more I just gave that pasta a taste test
and it is so delicious I can't wait to
eat
[Music]
so like I said I already tasted it but
it is really
delicious this so
delicious y'all so far I am two for two
this is so
good hello hello for dinner today I
really wanted to make a take of I guess
a plant-based take on cashew chicken but
I'll be using tofu so cashew tofu I
looked at a few recipes on how cashew
chicken is made and I realized I don't
have everything but I have some things
so we're going to improvise which is
where I thrive okay I love improvising
and I always encourage other people to
improvise as well so for any of the
meals that you see in this video if you
don't have everything that you possibly
need there is no need to run out to the
grocery store just try to improvise get
on Google
look up what can I substitute for this
ingredient that is what cooking is all
about making it your own and that's what
we're about to do today oh yeah and I
had some of that jerk pasta for lunch
today so delicious even the next day
make sure you give that one a try but
let's go ahead and get into dinner
tonight so typically this is a dish
where people combine chicken cashews
veggies and a thick sauce but instead
I'm using extra firm tofu I've shared
this before but whenever I want to make
tofu crispy I freeze it so I just freeze
it right in the pack and then I let it
thaw out and then I squeeze the excess
moisture out of it this changes the
texture and it really allows the tofu to
absorb much more of the flavor and then
it also helps make it a bit more firm
I've seen some videos where people boil
the tofu and that's supposed to be an
even better hack than the freezing
method I'm going to try it one day but I
haven't and if you have let me know in
the comments if it's worked out for you
but this time around I just broke the
tofu up into bite-sized pieces I added
some coconut aminos followed by a bit of
corn starch and I just let that sit
while I prepped my sauce now as I
mentioned I didn't have all the
ingredients that you would typically use
in a cashew tofu dish or cashew chicken
type of dish so I improvise and I use
hoiston sauce which has a Tangy salty
and to me a semisweet taste I added
coconut aminos which is a soy sauce
substitute some rice vinegar
chili crunch I also added warm water and
corn starch and that's just to help
thicken the sauce once we cook it on the
stove and I typically Bake My Tofu on
like 390 to 400Â° in the oven but if you
have an air fryer you can also put it in
the air fryer on
390Â° for about 12 minutes or so but in
the oven I bake it for about 30 minutes
so while that was going I brought out
the bell peppers and onions because like
I said that's clearly all I had this
week and I just cut those into
[Music]
[Music]
chunks at this point I remember that
garlic and ginger are key ingredients
for the sauce that's typically used but
because I ran all out of my fresh garlic
and I didn't have any Ginger I just used
my garlic powder and ground ginger and
again we're making do it what we have
okay next it was just time to cook up
the
[Music]
veggies so with this being a cashew tofu
you are probably wondering okay girl
when do the cashews come in and this is
where I just mixed a handful of cashews
and a bit of spray olive oil and then I
added that to a baking sheet with the
tofu this was after the tofu had been
cooking for about 20ish minutes or so
because I didn't want the cashews to
burn so I decided to wait until the tofu
had about 10 more minutes left and once
the tofu finishes in the oven the final
step is just to combine everything and
enjoy
[Music]
[Music]

with that

M mhm I'm so glad that I didn't let the

cuz I would have been missing out

cutting up these sweet potatoes and
giving them an ice bath to help them
crisp up though they didn't really get
as crispy as I wanted them to I think
the next time that I make these I'm
going to toss them in a bit of corn
starch what do you think let me know if
you have any tips on how to get sweet
potato fries crispy without deep frying
them because I did bake these anyway so
after prepping the sweet potato fries I
cooked up my veggies my plant-based
grounds and honestly that was really all

day and for the plantbased grounds I
actually combine that with a bit of my
fava bean tofu and then I just seasoned
it up with the basic seasonings like
garlic powder onion powder smoked
paprika cumin and I want to say salt and
pepper and that was

it I've been over here jamming but y'all
I'm about to take te these loaded fries
up honey okay the sweet potatoes are

eat it's time to give this a taste test
okay like we know I mean can you really

fries it's great another one make this
we made it to the end of the week and of
course it is time for dinner I'm opening
up a can of chickpeas because today I
wanted to make like a honestly I really
wanted to make my creamy jesa butter
beans because people are still making it
and still commenting on that video and I
looked at it again I was like oh my gosh
it looks so good but I was like you know
what switch it up don't do the same
thing again it's okay don't do the same
thing again so instead I decided to take
this lonely can of chickpeas that I had
in the pantry and do like a creamy tusin
chickpea dish I'm so excited I have some
quinoa that I prepped for the week and
that's what I'm going to enjoy it with
I'm really excited this is going to be
simple but delicious which is
what I enjoy most so let's go ahead and
get into dinner I'm about to drain these
cut my veggies and get to
cooking so after making this I realized
that this ended up being my take on
marry me chickpeas tusin chickpeas and
Mary me chickpeas are essentially the
same thing and I can't believe I haven't
made this dish before because when I
tell you it was so good listen but I'm
really glad that I did make it because I
got to enjoy it throughout the weekend
so I just started out by dicing up some
red onions I shredded my last bit of
Dino kale for the week and then I took
some cherry tomatoes and just half those
these were honestly on their last leg as
well but that's what these type of meals
are perfect for just kind of grabbing
items from your refrigerator and using
them up I would have added garlic to
this but again I ran all out and I made
a conscious decision not to go to the
grocery store again I wanted to wait
until I I got to go to the farmer's
market on Saturday after that I sauteed
the onions until they were tender with a
few crispy bits I added in those drained
and rinsed chickpeas the sundried
tomatoes along with some of that oil
that oil just adds a whole another layer
of flavor to the dish so if you cook
with oil I would definitely recommend
adding that to it I gave that a good mix
and then I added my seasoning so you
know good or faithful salt and black
pepper but not too much you know just
keep it light and then if you want to
add more salt and pepper at the end then
you can do so after everything has
cooked up I added garlic powder smoked
paprika and then a Greek seasoning blend
that I had but you can also do this with
Italian seasonings if that's what you
have on hand now for the creaminess
aspect of this dish I use unsweetened
original almond milk be sure to get
unsweetened original almond milk I know
sometimes you'll go to the store you'll
just buy original almond milk thinking
that it's not sweet but it is okay so
make sure you get unsweetened and then I
added more of my dairyfree cream cheese
as you can tell a lot of these meals
I've made this week call for similar
ingredients meaning by the end of the
week you would have used up most of the
items from the grocery list that you
made at the beginning of the week if you
decid to make all of these I also added
in nutritional yeast which honestly is a
must for quite a few of my recipes also
added in some vegetable broth and really
the last thing to do here is to let
everything simmer this is so good
listen I feel like you got to make
everything in this video but especially
make this if you just have one can of
chickpeas you don't know what to do with
it make this

dinner is served this little situation
too good okay please make this it's so
comforting reminds me like a good Sunday
dinner but yeah this is delicious I
really hope that you enjoyed this video
I hope that you got inspiration from all
these meals be sure to check the
